page.title: 08Gas Supply.
page.content: Situated two hundred metres north of Coldstream Farm Scottish Gas have a Transmission Reduction Station.The gas comes from gas fields 120 miles N.W of St Fergus near Peterhead.It comes from these fields through welded steel high pressure pipelines to St Fergus and hence through similar underground pipelines through Scotland and down into England.The pipelines carry gas at very high pressure{(up to 70 bar). { }At several points throughout Scotland the pressure is reduced to local internal pipelines.{(Which {operate at pressures up to 21 bar).} This is the maximum pressure which our pipelines to the site named Mountfleurie Transmission Reduction Station operates and the equipment there further reduces the pressure such that it can be distributed into the local grid system for Leven area
